solution_line_template: A century has {century_years} years, and if Gideon has as many marbles as the number of years in a century, he has {total_marbles} marbles.

If he gives {fraction_given_away} of the marbles to his sister, he gives out {fraction_given_away}*{total_marbles} = <<{fraction_given_away}*{total_marbles}={marbles_given_away}>>{marbles_given_away} marbles.

Gideon's total number of marbles remaining after giving 3/4 of the marbles to his sister is {total_marbles}-{marbles_given_away}=<<{total_marbles}-{marbles_given_away}={remaining_marbles}>>{remaining_marbles}.

When he multiplies the number of remaining marbles by {multiplier}, he gets his age five years from now, meaning he will be {remaining_marbles}*{multiplier}=<<{remaining_marbles}*{multiplier}={age_five_years_from_now}>>{age_five_years_from_now} years old five years from now.
